item.title: Fixing the Xcode 16 LLDB error "Couldn’t realize type of self”
item.description: How to fix the Xcode 16 LLDB error "Couldn’t realize type of self," which prevents you from easily debugging your iOS application.

item.title: The engineer you'd want to be
item.description: Writing code is just one aspect that will make you a good engineer. In a future where AI will be an integral part of every workflow, standing out in an increasingly crowded field will be important.

item.title: Don't hire for passion
item.description: Many interviews over the years and experiences lead me to believe that there are profiles that should be hired with caution; one of these is the passionate one.

item.title: Beyond specialization
item.description: In a complex world, specialization isn't always best. We often need good communicators and empathetic individuals to help groups evolve and create more value together.

item.title: Task & Threads in Swift Concurrency
item.description: The new Swift Concurrency model added the concept of Task in order to better manage asynchronous code execution. But what’s represent a Task and how it’s related to Threads?

item.title: The effect of indirect actions on team dynamics
item.description: How to act the next time you find yourself in a conversation that's giving off some bad vibes, or even an intense one.

item.title: Not everything has to be perfect the first time
item.description: It’s strange, but it often happens to many senior people; the more you move towards your career, the more it’s hard to love imperfection.

item.title: Thoughts on moving to a leadership role
item.description: Moving to a leadership role does not mean you will need to check every line of each PR, tearing your hair and hoping it will be not that bad day.

item.title: Healthy approach to code reviews
item.description: Code reviews are weird monsters.With no doubts they improve the overall quality of the code and help programmers build relationships and work together more effectively.

item.title: The broken window principle applied to software
item.description: One of the most cited articles in the history of criminology compared to how the software is maintened.

item.title: Modern networking in Swift
item.description: Modern networking library in Swift with async/await support

item.title: The economy of tech debt
item.description: All you need to know about tech debts along with a hands-on approach to managing it effectively in your development cycle.
